description: Emboldened by his triumph, the president-elect will enter the White House in January ready to make good on these MAGA campaign promises.
title: Your Guide to Trump’s Day-One Agenda — From Taxes to Tariffs

description: Richard Farley, a partner at Kramer Levin Naftalis & Frankel, and Kirkland & Ellis partner Norm Champ are among contenders to replace Gary Gensler as chair of the US Securities and Exchange Commission, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
title: Farley, Champ Among Candidates to Succeed Gensler as SEC Chair

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.    Email our editors here.
title: Biden’s Window to Cement a Legacy Is Closing Quickly

description: Dutch leaders across the political spectrum united in condemning antisemitic attacks against Israeli football fans in the Netherlands.
title: Dutch Leaders Unite to Decry Antisemitic Attacks on Israeli Fans

description: President-elect Donald Trump doesn’t take office for more than two months but he’s already shaping US policy in two major hot spots: Israel and Ukraine.
title: Trump Is Shaping US Foreign Policy Well Before He Takes Office

description: Saudi Arabia’s Crown Prince Mohammed Bin Salman called Donald Trump in the early hours of Wednesday to express his joy at the Republican’s return to power, according to two people with knowledge of the exchange.
title: Saudi Crown Prince Reached Out to Trump in Late-Night Phone Call

description: Susie Wiles, the no-drama adult in the room who steered Donald Trump’s 2024 revival, quietly achieved a comeback of her own in becoming the first woman tapped to become White House chief of staff.
title: Architect of Trump’s Win Becomes First Woman Tapped as Chief of Staff

description: For much of his campaign to return to the White House, President-elect Donald Trump was facing four separate criminal prosecutions. Now that he’s won, prosecutors are moving to drop his two federal cases, and the two cases brought by states are in peril as well.
title: What’s Happening With Trump’s Criminal Cases Now That He’s Been Reelected?

description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen has an idea for reducing the bloc’s consumption of Russian liquefied natural gas: import more from America.
title: EU’s Von der Leyen Suggests US LNG Could Replace Russian Supply

description: Elon Musk joined a call between President-elect Donald Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy, highlighting the billionaire entrepreneur’s influence within the incoming US administration.
title: Elon Musk Joined Trump’s Call With Ukraine’s Zelenskiy

description: Trump’s comeback reveals dark truths about the country.
title: ‘I’m Suffering’: What the 2024 Election Taught Me About America

description: It looks like German Chancellor Olaf Scholz is at the back of the line when it comes to getting access to the next Trump White House.
title: Scholz Has Made Germany a Target for the Scorn of Musk and Trump

description: A federal judge paused the election interference prosecution against President-elect Donald Trump, canceling all upcoming court deadlines as Special Counsel Jack Smith winds down the case.
title: Judge Pauses Trump Election Case at Special Counsel Request

description: Control of the US House hung Friday on the outcomes of some two dozen races, with Republicans strongly favored to claim a trifecta following Donald Trump’s victory and party gains in the Senate.
title: Trump’s Hopes for GOP Trifecta Hinge on Two Dozen US House Races

description: China’s economic growth target of 5% this year is looking ambitious, given sluggish consumer spending, an uncertain outlook for the country’s exports and a still shaky property market. President Xi Jinping’s government spent recent months trying to fix those problems via a succession of stimulus measures that left investors clamoring for more decisive action. Now the election of Donald Trump as US president, with his threat of steep tariffs on Chinese goods, has cast another shadow over the worl
title: Can Xi Fix China’s Economy as Trump Tariff Threat Looms?

description: There was no holding Olaf Scholz back as he told astonished reporters in the halls of Berlin’s chancellery building on Wednesday why he had just decided to dismiss Finance Minister Christian Lindner and bury his own three-party coalition.
title: Scholz Kept Rolling Over for German Finance Chief. Then He Cracked

description: Wall Street would be helped by a less-stringent version of crucial banking regulation that’s expected once US President-elect Donald Trump takes office, Citigroup Inc. Chief Executive Officer Jane Fraser said.
title: Citi CEO Says Banks to Benefit From Expected Trump Regulations

description: A project to triple the capacity of the Trans Mountain Pipeline still has a high value after massive cost overruns to build it, Canada’s government spending watchdog concluded.
title: Canada’s New Oil Pipeline Worth Up to $24 Billion, Report Finds

description: The proportion of UK births to two parents also born in the country slipped below 60% last year for the first time since records began, as the rising cost of living and lifestyle changes dented Britons’ desire to have children.
title: UK Births to British-Born Parents Tumble to Lowest on Record

description: Economists and strategists across Wall Street have dialed back their expectations for US interest-rate cuts next year based on this week’s presidential election of Donald Trump and comments by Federal Reserve boss Jerome Powell.
title: Wall Street Fed Watchers Dial Back 2025 Rate-Cut Expectations

description: The president-elect’s hostility to climate tech has venture capitalists already thinking about how to step in and buoy the sector.
title: Trump’s Return Is Set to Revive Investment in Climate Startups

description: Millions of undocumented migrants facing prospects of mass deportation under US President-Elect Donald Trump are unlikely to find refuge in the country’s northern neighbor this time around.
title: US, Canada Tougher Border Rules Leave Little Choice For Migrants

description: Mexico’s President Claudia Sheinbaum will travel to the Group of 20 meeting in Brazil later this month with a delegation that includes Energy Minister Luz Elena Gonzalez and Foreign Affairs Minister Juan Ramon de la Fuente.
title: Mexico Plans to Address Development and Digitalization at G-20

description: A rightward shift across demographic groups and geographies powered Trump’s decisive victory and keeps Capitol Hill stacked with his allies.
title: New York to San Francisco, Florida to Texas: Red Wave Sweeps America

description: Peru’s government ordered millions of school children to stay home next week to keep the streets of Lima clear for visiting world leaders.
title: Peru Shuts Schools to Clear Lima’s Streets for Biden and Xi

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz signaled he’s open to discussing the timing of an early election as long as opposition lawmakers back legislation he wants to pass before his term ends.
title: Scholz Says Ready to Discuss Timing of Snap German Election

description: The EU is seeking to accelerate talks with the UK on a new defense and security pact, with the election of Donald Trump raising concerns in Europe that it will need to boost aid to Ukraine amid the possibility of reduced American support.
title: UK and EU Hasten Work on Defense Pact After Trump’s Victory

description: Investors who won a $16 billion judgment against Argentina over its nationalization of energy firm YPF SA more than a decade ago are open to receiving payment in bonds instead of cash, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Burford Open to Argentine Bonds for $16 Billion Judgment

description: Trump has signaled he’s against a possible ban of the viral video-sharing app
title: TikTok Hopes for Lifeline From President-Elect Trump, Who Once Favored Ban

description: Ireland’s prime minister Simon Harris officially called an early general election on Friday afternoon, with the vote to take place on Nov. 29.
title: Irish PM Calls Election, Seeks Dissolution of Parliament

description: The industry is taking a victory lap — and betting its lavish and bipartisan spending translates to influence in Washington.
title: Crypto’s $135 Million Campaign Is Undefeated in 48 Races So Far

description: The European Union should push ahead urgently to lower national barriers and build a capital markets union to help the bloc foster innovation with a more suitable financing ecosystem, European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said.
title: Lagarde Urges EU Leaders to Accelerate Capital Markets Union

description: Chinese President Xi Jinping told Italian President Sergio Mattarella that China is willing to import more of Italy’s high-quality products and expand their business ties.
title: Xi Says China Willing to Boost Imports, Business Ties With Italy

description: Veteran diplomat Jonathan Powell, who was instrumental in negotiating the peace process in Northern Ireland as a former adviser to Tony Blair, is the UK’s new national security adviser.
title: Starmer Picks Blair-Era Veteran Jonathan Powell as UK Security Adviser

description: European Union leaders are trying to work out whether they can keep the Ukrainian war effort going if Donald Trump decides to shut off support from the US.
title: EU Is Looking at Ramping Up Ukraine Aid If Trump Pulls the Plug

description: The landmark labor wins of the past few years are vulnerable to a hostile government. American workers will have to fight even harder.
title: What Trump Can Do to Workers’ Biden-Era Gains

description: Oil companies and some Republican lawmakers support parts of the Inflation Reduction Act, making outright repeal less likely than new restrictions, caps and expiration dates.
title: Trump Plans to Dismantle Biden’s Climate Law. It Won’t Be Easy

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Beijing Sees Bruising Times Ahead With Trump Return

description: China wants a deal with US President-elect Donald Trump but doesn’t expect the path to an agreement will be easy, according to an adviser to the Foreign Ministry in Beijing.
title: China Wants a Deal With Trump, Foreign Ministry Adviser Says

description: After months of caution in the run-up to the US presidential election, hedge funds have emerged as big buyers of US stocks.
title: Hedge Funds Show Up as Buyers of US Stocks Post-Election

description: The industry made a $135 million bet on the election. It paid off spectacularly.
title: The Crypto World’s Victory Lap Begins

description: President-elect Donald Trump has vowed to impose massive new tariffs upon entering office on Jan. 20, calling them “the greatest thing ever invented.” And unlike some of his other campaign promises, he’s been consistent, repeatedly suggesting he’ll impose a 10% to 20% tariff on all foreign goods and a tariff of 60% or higher on products coming from China.
title: How Trump Could Put His Campaign Promises on Tariffs Into Action

description: The European Union and China said they made some progress after a week of technical talks in Beijing aimed at scaling back or reversing tariffs that the bloc applied to electric vehicles made in China.
title: EU and China Tout Progress on Negotiations to Avoid EV Tariffs

description: Calm returned to Mozambique’s capital on Friday after police used deadly violence to break up a wave of post-election protests that shook Maputo the day before.
title: Calm Returns to Mozambique Capital After Deadly Day of Protests

description: Following the collapse of Germany’s coalition government this week, Economy Minister Robert Habeck announced his return to X, saying social media platforms like Elon Musk’s shouldn’t be the domain of “loudmouths and populists.”
title: German Economy Minister Habeck Returns to X After Five Years

description: Dutch police arrested 57 people after clashes between Israeli and pro-Palestinian football fans in Amsterdam, with the leaders of the Netherlands and Israel condemning the “anti-Semitic” violence.
title: Dutch Police Arrest 57 After Attacks Against Israeli Football Fans in Amsterdam

description: China announced a 10 trillion yuan ($1.4 trillion) program to refinance local government debt, as Beijing rolls out more measures to support a slowing economy facing new risks from the reelection of Donald Trump.
title: China Unveils $1.4 Trillion Debt Swap to Help Local Governments

description: Europe won’t be able to finance Ukraine’s defenses against Russia’s invasion on its own if the US withdraws support under Donald Trump’s next presidency, Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban said Friday.
title: Europe Can’t Fund ‘Lost’ War in Ukraine Without US, Orban Says

description: German opposition leader Friedrich Merz accused Chancellor Olaf Scholz of seeking to delay an early election until March purely for party political advantage and reiterated his demand for a January vote.
title: German Opposition Leader Says Scholz Vote Delay ‘Irresponsible’

description: Republican Donald Trump defeated Democrat Kamala Harris in Nevada, NBC and CNN projected, flipping a battleground that had previously backed Democrats in 2016 and 2020.
title: Trump Wins Battleground State of Nevada

description: In an election against a female opponent in which abortion rights was a hot campaign topic, Republican Donald Trump made a risky gamble to bank on support from men. And it worked.
title: How Trump’s Bet on Male Voters Won Him the 2024 Election

description: On this episode of Merryn Talks Money, we discuss what the Republican’s second term means for the US, the UK and the Tesla CEO.
title: Why Trump’s Victory Is Musk’s ‘Tech-Bro Coup’

description: France is hoping to persuade Poland into joining forces to block a trade deal between the European Union and Latin America’s Mercosur bloc that’s been a quarter of a century in the making.
title: France Seeks to Rope in Poland to Block Mercosur Trade Deal

description: Fresh off a bitter feud with Elon Musk over his social media platform X, Brazil is now courting a Chinese company to compete with the US billionaire’s Starlink internet service.
title: Brazil Woos Chinese Starlink Rival Maker After Feuding With Musk

description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. enacted on Friday two laws bolstering his nation’s maritime claims and pushed to tap energy resources, as tensions with Beijing in the South China Sea persist.
title: Marcos Signs Laws on Philippine Sea Rights as China Row Persists

description: Chinese builder Hopson Development Holdings Ltd. is in talks for a new private loan to refinance an expired bridge facility that backed the purchase of some property in Hong Kong, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Chinese Builder Hopson in Talks With Temasek Unit for Loan

description: The return of Donald Trump to the White House is unlikely to reshape the US and the Philippines’ longstanding security alliance, but his economic policies and their impact would take center stage, according to Manila’s envoy to Washington.
title: Trump Win Spurs Defense Ally Philippines to Shield Economic Ties

description: China’s bond traders are watching a key legislative meeting this week where lawmakers are expected to approve a fiscal package worth trillions of yuan.
title: China Bond Market Eyes Fiscal Plans From Key Legislative Meeting

description: Levi Strauss & Co. heir Daniel Lurie is set to become mayor of San Francisco after spending more than $7 million of his own money to position himself as a political outsider who could best tackle the city’s homelessness, drug and crime problems.
title: Levi Strauss Heir Daniel Lurie Set to Win San Francisco Mayor’s Race

description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell made clear he’s ready to defend the US central bank from political pressure following the re-election of Donald Trump, saying he wouldn’t resign if asked and insisting the incoming president doesn’t have the power to fire him or other senior Fed leaders.
title: Powell Signals Readiness to Defy Trump in Defense of Fed

description: Taiwan relies on the US to defend it against China, but Trump’s transactional approach raises questions about his commitment to the island democracy.
title: At Bars and Comedy Clubs, Taiwan Processes Trump’s Victory
